summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York City residence and his private island, Little Saint James. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking and conspiracy crimes spanning from 1994 to 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the warrant. Devices were seized from his person and his residences in New York and the Virgin Islands. The investigation seeks evidence of his crimes and his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The search seeks evidence of communications with her and her involvement in the subject offenses.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

persons.name: Special Agent I
persons.context: The FBI agent who seized two hard drives from a blue suitcase during the search of Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly names Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses (sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement to travel).
The FBI agent was involved in the execution of the search warrant at Epstein's New York residence, seizing evidence from him.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI. Two electronic devices (a silver iPad and a black iPhone) were seized from his person during this arrest.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James island
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from various structures on the island.

events.title: Warrant issued for forensic search of devices
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant, authorizing the forensic examination of the 62 seized devices for evidence of crimes from 1994 to 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Jeffrey Epstein's private island)
St. Thomas Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties: 2 from his person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein, and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her and her involvement.

The search seeks evidence for violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. 1591), transportation of minors (2422), enticement to travel (2423), and conspiracy (371), covering the period from 1994 to August 2019.

The warrant authorizes a search for specific categories of evidence including nude photos of teenage girls, child erotica, financial records of payments to victims/conspirators, and travel records for victims.
The document indicates redactions, with blanks in the text where other co-conspirator names might have been listed alongside Ghislaine Maxwell.
